item.title: South Korea Targets Cambodia’s Scam Industry After Kidnappings, Torture and a Death
item.description: South Korea’s efforts are part of a widening international crackdown on criminal groups running online fraud schemes from Southeast Asia.

item.title: First Burials to Be Held for Israelis Returned From Gaza
item.description: Hamas has handed over the bodies of eight people, but says it is struggling to find the remains of others in Gaza after two years of war.

item.title: Spies, Burgers and Bombs: After a New War, Old Wounds Resurface in Tehran
item.description: A deep sense of unease has gripped Iran since American and Israeli airstrikes in June, but on a recent visit to the capital, we found that many Irania...

item.title: L.A. County Declares State of Emergency Over Immigration Raids
item.description: The move would allow county officials to provide financial aid to those affected by Immigration and Customs Enforcement raids.

item.title: A Repressive Russian Ally Feels a Mysterious Thaw From the U.S.
item.description: Analysts say they are unsure what the Trump administration hopes to get out of its gifts and concessions to Belarus’s autocratic leader.
